verses.verse: {Wisdom's Blessings} d People do the planning, {Lit. Preparations of the heart belong to human beings} but the end result {Or the response of the tongue} is from the Lord .
Everything a person does seems pure in his own opinion, but the Lord weighs intentions.
Entrust your work to the Lord , and your planning will succeed.
The Lord made everything answerable to him, including the wicked at the time of trouble. {Lit. evil}
The Lord detests those who are proud; truly they will not go unpunished.
Iniquity is atoned for by gracious love and truth, and through fear of the Lord people {The Heb. lacks people} turn from evil.
When a person's ways please the Lord , even his enemies will be at peace with him.
A little gain {The Heb. lacks gain} with righteousness is better than great income without justice.
A person plans his way, but the Lord directs his steps.
When a king is ready to speak officially, {Lit. king speaks an oracle} what he says should not err with respect to justice.
Honest scales and balances are from the Lord ; he made all the weights in the bag.
Kings detest wrong-doing, for through righteousness the throne is established.
Kings take pleasure in righteous speech; they treasure a person who speaks what is upright.
The king's wrath results in a death sentence, but whoever is wise will appease him.
When a king is pleased, {Lit. a king's face lightens} there is life, and his favor is like a cloud that brings spring rain.
How much better than gaining gold is the acquisition of wisdom, the attainment of wisdom better than silver!
The road of the upright circumvents evil, and whoever watches how he lives {Lit. watches his path} preserves his life.
Pride precedes destruction; an arrogant spirit appears before a fall.
Better to be humble among the poor, than to share what is stolen with the proud.
Whoever listens to a word of instruction prospers, and anyone who trusts in the Lord is blessed.
The wise-hearted person is told to be discerning, and that pleasant speech promotes instruction.
Anyone who has understanding is a fountain of life, but foolishness brings punishment to fools.
A wise person's thoughts {Lit. heart} control his words, and his speech promotes instruction.
Pleasant words are honey from a honeycomb sweet to the soul and healing for the body. {Lit. bone}
{Advice to the Wise} d There is a road that seems right for a man to travel, {The Heb. lacks to travel} but in the end it's the road to death.
The appetite of the laborer motivates him; indeed, his hunger drives him on.
A worthless person concocts evil gossip {The Heb. lacks gossip} his lips are like a burning fire.
A deceitful man stirs dissension, and anyone who gossips separates friends.
A violent man entices his companion and leads him on a path that is not good.
Whoever winks knowingly {Lit. with his eyes} is plotting {So MT; LXX Syr Targ Vg read winks with his eyes considers} deceit; anyone who purses his lips is bent towards evil.
Gray hair is a crown of glory; it is obtained by following {The Heb. lacks following} a righteous path.
Whoever controls his temper is better than a warrior, and anyone who has control of his spirit is better than someone who captures a city.
The dice is cast into someone's lap, but the outcome is from the Lord .
